page.title: 09The Law in Eccleshall
page.content: The first petty sessions recorded at Eccleshall were held in 185i, monthly, at the Royal Oak. In 1876 the court moved to the Town Hall and in 1912 a new Court House was opened in the High Street, comprising a police court, magistrates' room and clerk's office. Today the same court house is used, with two, occasionally three, courts held every Friday except Good Friday. There are 13 magistrates: 6 ladies and 7 men. The{Police Authority}now owns the building, part of which is used as a police station. There is a cell, and a pound for stray dogs. The majority of the motoring offences take place on the M6 motorway, which traverses the Eccleshall area. {Eccleshall Magistr- {ates' Bench}is part of the Stafford, Stone and Eccleshall division, the clerk's office being in the new court premises in Stafford.
